column2: The product has experienced a firmware error.

1. Press the power button to turn the product off. 2. If a surge protector is being used, remove it. Plug the power cord directly into a wall outlet. 3. Wait at least 30 seconds, turn the product on, and then wait for the product to initialize. 4. If the error persists, disconnect and then reconnect the FFCs and the connectors on the formatter PCA. 5. If the error persists, replace the formatter PCA.
Fuser open error. Low sub-thermistor fuser error. High sub-thermistor fuser error
The product has an internal hardware error.

1. Press the power button to turn the product off.2. If a surge protector is in use, remove it. Connect the power cord directly into a wall outlet.3. Wait at least 25 minutes, turn the product on, and then wait for the product to initialize.4. If the error persists, reconnect J101 and J552 on the engine controller PCA.5. If the error persists, check the power source. Make sure that the power source meets the minimum system requirements (40Hz to 70Hz).6. If the error persists, replace the fuser.7. If the error persists, replace the engine controller PCA.
Black scanner laser error (inline devices only)
The printer has experienced an internal hardware error. The product may display the following message: 51.20 Black laser scanner error

Turn off the power by using the power switch, wait at least 30 seconds, and then turn on the power and wait for the printer to initialize. If a surge protector is used, remove it. Plug the printer directly into the wall socket. Use the power switch to turn on the printer. If the message persists, contact HP support.
Verify that the DC controller connectors are firmly connected. If the error persists, replace the temperature/humidity sensor. If the error persists, replace the DC controller.
Verify that the cables between the DC controller is firmly connected.
If the error persists, replace the color misregistration sensor.
If the error persists, replace the DC controller.
Black CPR pattern cannot be read

1. Turn off the power by using the power switch, and then wait at least 30 seconds.2. Turn on the power and wait for the product to initialize. If the error persists, verify that the cables between the color misregistration sensor and the DC controller are firmly connected. If the error persists, replace the color misregistration sensor. If the error persists, replace the toner cartridge tray. If the error persists, replace the DC controller.
1. Turn off the power by using the power switch, and then wait at least 30 seconds.2. Turn on the power and wait for the product to initialize. If the error persists, replace the DC controller.
If the error persists, replace the DC controller. If the error persists, replace the product.
Verify that the DC controller connectors are firmly connected. If the error persists, replace the DC controller.

The printer has experienced an error with one of the internal sensors. The product may display one of the following messages:• 54.18 Black toner level sensor error• 54.19 TOP sensor error• 54.1200 Black density measurement abnormality• 54.1500 Black CPR pattern cant be read• 54.21 BD errors

Turn off the power by using the power switch, wait at least 30 seconds, and then turn on the power and wait for the printer to initialize. If a surge protector is used, remove it. Plug the printer directly into the wall socket. Use the power switch to turn on the printer. If the message persists, contact HP support.

The printer has experienced an internal error. The printer may experience one of the following errors:• 55.0 DC controller communication error• 55.0601 DC controller NVRAM data error• 55.0602 DC controller NVRAM access error• 55.1 DC controller memory errortern ca

Turn off the power by using the power switch, wait at least 30 seconds, and then turn on the power and wait for the printer to initialize. If a surge protector is used, remove it. Plug the printer directly into the wall socket. Use the power switch to turn on the printer.
The product has a general fan error.

1. Press the power button to turn the product off.2. If a surge protector is in use, remove it. Connect the power cord directly into a wall outlet.3. Wait at least 30 seconds, turn the product on, and then wait for the product to initialize.4. If the error persists, reconnect the J1103 connector on the duplex connector PCA.5. If the error persists, replace the main fan.

The printer has experienced a problem with one of the motors. The product may display one of the following errors:• 59.3 Fuser motor startup error• 59.4 Fuser motor rotation error• 59.50 Image drum motor startup error - black• 59.73 Developer motor startup error• 59.83 Developer motor rotation error• 59.C0 Developer motor rotation error• 59.F0 Transfer alienation failure

Turn off the power by using the power switch, wait at least 30 seconds, and then turn on the power and wait for the printer to initialize. If a surge protector is used, remove it. Plug the printer directly into the wall socket. Use the power switch to turn on the printer.
The product has experienced a firmware error

error1. Press the power button to turn the product off.2. If a surge protector is in use, remove it. Connect the power cord directly into a wall outlet.3. Wait at least 30 seconds, turn the product on, and then wait for the product to initialize.4. If the error persists, disconnect and then reconnect the FFCs and the connectors on the formatter PCA.5. If the issue persists, replace the formatter PCA.
